Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

DonorSearch is the leading provider of prospect research solutions and AI-powered technologies, serving over 6,800 nonprofit organizations across the US. Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

" Provide solutions to for data visualization to track experimental results and stock of critical reagents

Tasks requiring Skilled Ability:

" General scientific understanding in the following areas:
o PCR, cloning, and pDNA preparation
o Capillary electrophoresis, SDS page, UPLC-MS, UV-ABS
o Affinity Chromatography
o Cell Culture and Transfection
o ELISA and Activity Assays
o mRNA Formulation (PNP, LNP, etc.)
" Ability to summarize complex scientific processes highlighting key process and data collection steps

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Company Description

BeVera Solutions, LLC is a fast-growing Data Science Consulting provider focused on delivering high-value solutions to its Federal Government customers. BeVera places a high premium on Integrity and Respect for all employees. Our CEO values every employee and fosters that attitude throughout the company. We offer competitive compensation packages as well as interesting and important work assignments. BeVera is striving to be recognized as one of the best places to work in America.

Job Description

BeVera is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Scientist to work as part of a multidisciplinary team to support the CDC’s newly formed Center for Forecasting and Analysis (CFA). CFA’s goal is to enable timely, effective decision-making to improve outbreak responses. BeVera is looking for a qualified, experienced, data scientist to provide data modeling, forecasting, analysis, and systems integration to respond to outbreaks in real-time, driving effective decision making.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

Data Scientist II (Clinical)
Waltham, MA

General:
" Implementation of data analysis and process workflows across Waltham R&B

" Provide solutions to for data visualization to track experimental results and stock of critical reagents

o PCR, cloning, and pDNA preparation
o Capillary electrophoresis, SDS page, UPLC-MS, UV-ABS
o Affinity Chromatography
o Cell Culture and Transfection
o ELISA and Activity Assays
o mRNA Formulation (PNP, LNP, etc.)
" Ability to summarize complex scientific processes highlighting key process and data collection steps

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Job Description

BeVera is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Scientist to work as part of a multidisciplinary team to support the CDC’s newly formed Center for Forecasting and Analysis (CFA). BeVera is looking for a qualified, experienced, data scientist to provide data modeling, forecasting, analysis, and systems integration to respond to outbreaks in real-time, driving effective decision making.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

Data Scientist II (Clinical)
Waltham, MA

General:
" Implementation of data analysis and process workflows across Waltham R&B

" Provide solutions to for data visualization to track experimental results and stock of critical reagents

o PCR, cloning, and pDNA preparation
o Capillary electrophoresis, SDS page, UPLC-MS, UV-ABS
o Affinity Chromatography
o Cell Culture and Transfection
o ELISA and Activity Assays
o mRNA Formulation (PNP, LNP, etc.)
" Ability to summarize complex scientific processes highlighting key process and data collection steps

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

Data Scientist II (Clinical)
Waltham, MA
12 Months contract
Pay Range: $50-65/hr on w2

General:
" Implementation of data analysis and process workflows across Waltham R&B
" Transversal collaborative work with mRNA center of Excellence community and collaborators to achieve objectives.
" Key user of the electronic laboratory notebook (Benching) to support the team and development of a user-friendly benching process for work and data collection
" Traceability of samples, reagents, and their storage for the HT platform pipeline
" Implementation of Sample\Reagent barcode solution in the electronic laboratory notebook (Benchling)
" Provide solutions to for data visualization to track experimental results and stock of critical reagents

Tasks requiring Skilled Ability:
" Looking for a PhD or MS candidate in molecular biology or related field with data science experience including strong understanding of electronic laboratory notebooks (Benchling experience preferred)
" Assist in sample submission and management for samples throughout mRNA platform production pipeline
" General scientific understanding in the following areas:
o PCR, cloning, and pDNA preparation
o Capillary electrophoresis, SDS page, UPLC-MS, UV-ABS
o Affinity Chromatography
o Cell Culture and Transfection
o ELISA and Activity Assays
o mRNA Formulation (PNP, LNP, etc.)
" Ability to summarize complex scientific processes highlighting key process and data collection steps

Responsibilities:
- Utilize advanced analytics techniques to extract insights from large datasets
- Develop and implement data mining algorithms to identify patterns and trends
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and provide data-driven solutions
- Design and build predictive models to support decision-making processes
- Conduct statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to validate findings
- Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science
- Strong knowledge of data mining techniques and algorithms
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
- Experience working with big data platforms and tools
- Familiarity with VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) for automation tasks
- Quantum engineering knowledge is a plus
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Strong communication and presentation skills

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

Role: Data Engineer / Data Scientist
Duration: Long-term contract
Location: Iselin, NJ or Charlotte, NC – 3 days onsite in a week.
10-14 years of experience
Create and maintain data flow design and technical requirements documentation using defined documentation templates that meets Agile product development standards (such as data analysis or methodology, MS Excel calculations).
Understanding business objectives and developing models that help to achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress.

Galaxy Technologies is looking to hire a highly creative data scientist to address data analytics challenges in our organization, to collect large volumes of data from varying sources, clean and interpret data, create solutions to overcome challenges, and communicate with interested parties.
To succeed in this position; you need to be curious, creative, and tech-savvy. You need to stay up to date with data programming software and apps, have an outstanding understanding of statistics and mathematics and be proficient in writing algorithms. Top candidates will be persistent and have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Data Scientist Responsibilities:
Having meetings with team members regarding projects.

Spalding Consulting, Inc. is seeking a Data Scientist at MCAS Cherry Point at Havelock, NC. Spalding Consulting, Inc. is a professional services company delivering cutting-edge solutions to the Department of Defense since 2001. Our expert-level solutions include software development, information technology, program management, financial management and business intelligence services. Spalding Consulting offers competitive compensation, career development, flexible work schedules and excellent benefits.

Position Type: Full-Time

Come join our team as we support Naval Aviation at Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point. If you seek a dynamic work environment that challenges you to learn and grow in data analysis, visualization, AI and ML, we have the opportunity for you.

Essential Functions:




Must be eligible to obtain a Secret clearance. Requirements to obtain a clearance include US Citizenship, security investigation, etc.


BS or BA degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Relevant Technical Discipline. Preferred. Additional years of experience may replace degree requirements.

Spalding Consulting, Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. We will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ethnic origin, national origin, creed, religion, political belief, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, military status, physical or mental disability, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local laws. Spalding Consulting, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages minorities, women, disabled, and veterans to apply for job openings within our company.

Company Description

BeVera Solutions, LLC is a fast-growing Data Science Consulting provider focused on delivering high-value solutions to its Federal Government customers. BeVera places a high premium on Integrity and Respect for all employees. Our CEO values every employee and fosters that attitude throughout the company. We offer competitive compensation packages as well as interesting and important work assignments. BeVera is striving to be recognized as one of the best places to work in America.

Job Description

BeVera is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Scientist to work as part of a multidisciplinary team to support the CDC’s newly formed Center for Forecasting and Analysis (CFA). CFA’s goal is to enable timely, effective decision-making to improve outbreak responses. BeVera is looking for a qualified, experienced, data scientist to provide data modeling, forecasting, analysis, and systems integration to respond to outbreaks in real-time, driving effective decision making.

The Junior Data Scientist is a talented, creative, and motivated data scientist who loves data. The role is supporting our organization with data research and transformation for analytics. This individual will be responsible for ensuring data availability in a timely manner and data accuracy from many disparate systems for reporting and statistical analysis.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
•
Build and maintain systems and processes by which we can review and verify the integrity and quality of our data before sharing with internal and external parties
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
•

Job_Title: Data Scientist / Machine learning/scRNASeq data Analysis
Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Data Scientist (Consultant)
Simatree is actively looking for a Data Scientist to provide strategic support to federal government agencies by applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analyses, and building high-quality prediction systems and reporting procedures. The Data Scientist will help prepare the results of their analyses to internal and external stakeholders to inform mission-critical activities such as budget forecasting, capacity planning, and program evaluation. The Data Scientist will work on a dynamic team comprised of highly experienced policy and program design specialists, data engineers, visualization specialists, and highly engaged clients to meet fast-paced project requirements and provide analytic and program management support.
Responsibilities:

Description of Roles and Responsibilities:
· Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
· Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses

As a junior Data Scientist, the expectation is to have a passion for organization, be a motivated self-starter, always ask questions, challenge the norms, as well as be curious.
Example Task Descriptions:
List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Background:
DonorSearch is the leading provider of prospect research solutions and AI-powered technologies, serving over 6,800 nonprofit organizations across the US. We are family-owned, headquartered in Maryland, and have a rapidly-growing remote workforce in every U.S. timezone. With our outstanding reputation and team of innovative professionals, we seek someone to join us to expand our brand and make a lasting impact on the world.
At DonorSearch, we value: Innovation, Excellence, Growth, Collaboration, and Quality.
Job Summary:
DonorSearch Ai introduced deep learning and machine learning into the nonprofit sector by building custom models with a robust interactive visualization tool to help organizations fundraise more efficiently. The Data Scientist will use best-in-class machine learning technologies to develop machine learning algorithms to meet various objectives of fundraising staff.

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

In this role you will be building and deploying machine learning models using both analytical algorithms and deep learning approaches.

Job Description:

Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).

Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

•

Job_Desc:
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Project involves developing multi-omics directed graph networks based on causal inference framework based on multiple data types (e.g., clinical, RNA-seq, epigenetic, proteomic, and/or genetic data).
Skills:
Must be expert in at least one area of causal inference such as interpretable machine learning or data fusion problem, e.g., to reduce space of plausible causal relationships and how data from multiple sources can be combined to make causal inferences.
Experience with machine learning in the context of causal inference, so that the predictive models are more than just a black box, is strongly desired.

Background:
DonorSearch is the leading provider of prospect research solutions and AI-powered technologies, serving over 6,800 nonprofit organizations across the US. About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

In this role you will be building and deploying machine learning models using both analytical algorithms and deep learning approaches.

· Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis

· Building tools to automate data collection
· Searching through large data sets for usable information
· Creating reports and presentations for business uses
· Correlating similar data to find actionable results

List Matching - Be able to match a client list to our internal database following the internal template, as well as client direction.
Reporting - Be the key contact person in the organization and orchestration of reporting tasks.
Data Analysis - Take a data set given in detailed format and be creative with aggregations to help the data tell a story to the requestor.
Data Pipelines - Provide support and feedback on the current running data pipelines. Also make enhancements to the structure and workflow.

About Us:
At Parafin, our mission is to grow small businesses. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, yet banks do not have their back. Parafin is a technology company that builds infrastructure which enables small businesses to get easy access to financial services via platforms they sell on.

Parafin's first product offers capital-as-a-service for online platforms. Parafin currently powers the capital programs of platforms ranging from Series B to post-IPO companies such as DoorDash, Amazon, and Worldpay. We are a tight-knit team of engineers and designers, coming from organizations such as Stripe, Square, Plaid, Coinbase, Robinhood, Affirm, Uber, and CERN, and are excited both about helping hundreds of thousands of small businesses grow and thrive, and building products that leaders at top companies have started to use every day.

We are backed by prominent venture capitalists such as Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, GIC, Index Ventures, Green Oaks Capital, and SV Angel.

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).

About HealthRhythms
At HealthRhythms, our mission is to alleviate unnecessary suffering by bringing mental health into the modern era of medicine. We have combined the multi-dimensional sensing capabilities of mobile phones with the power of embedded and cloud computing platforms and novel AI algorithms to continuously measure mental health status. We are realizing the vision of precision medicine for mental health by anticipating deterioration of mental health and delivering personalized, just-in-time interventions.
We have built and tested this platform with $7M of NIH funding and are commercializing with a dual-track focus on pharma and US payors. Based on the elite quality of the team, the empirical evidence, and the innovation itself, we have closed a highly over-subscribed $11M seed financing with 36+ top Silicon Valley health tech and healthcare investors. Brook Byers (Kleiner) personally co-anchored the round with GSR Ventures ($3B health tech).
